What is the R code to list the planets in the Solar System in order of their distance from the Sun, starting from the closest and ending at the furthest? The table below provides the planet names and their corresponding distances:
\begin{center}
 \begin{tabular}{||c c||} 
 \hline
 Planet & Distance (AU) \\ [0.5ex] 
 \hline\hline
 Mercury & 0.39 \\ 
 Venus & 0.72 \\
 Earth & 1.00 \\
 Mars & 1.52 \\
 Jupiter & 5.20 \\
 Saturn & 9.58 \\
 Uranus & 19.18 \\
 Neptune & 30.07 \\ [1ex] 
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
\end{center}
Please use the following R code to complete the task and ensure that the code sorts the planets based on their distance accurately:
\begin{lstlisting}[language=R]
planet_distances <- data.frame(
    planet = c("Mercury", "Venus", "Earth", "Mars", "Jupiter", "Saturn", "Uranus", "Neptune"),
    distance = c(0.39, 0.72, 1.00, 1.52, 5.20, 9.58, 19.18, 30.07)
)
ordered_planets <- planet_distances[order(planet_distances$distance),]
print(ordered_planets$planet)
\end{lstlisting}

Certainly! The R code provided is already set up to list the planets in the Solar System according to their distance from the Sun, starting from the closest. Here's an explanation of how the code works:

```r
# Create a data frame with planet names and their corresponding distances from the Sun
planet_distances <- data.frame(
    planet = c("Mercury", "Venus", "Earth", "Mars", "Jupiter", "Saturn", "Uranus", "Neptune"),
    distance = c(0.39, 0.72, 1.00, 1.52, 5.20, 9.58, 19.18, 30.07)
)

# Order the planets based on their distance from the Sun
ordered_planets <- planet_distances[order(planet_distances$distance),]

# Print the names of the planets in the order of their distance from the Sun
print(ordered_planets$planet)
```

### Explanation:
- A data frame named `planet_distances` is created with two columns: `planet` for the planet names and `distance` for their respective distances from the Sun in astronomical units (AU).
- The `order` function is used to sort the data frame by the `distance` column.
- The planets are printed in order of increasing distance from the Sun using `print(ordered_planets$planet)`.

When you run this code, it will output the names of the planets in the order of their proximity to the Sun:

```
[1] "Mercury" "Venus" "Earth" "Mars" "Jupiter" "Saturn" "Uranus" "Neptune"
```

This output confirms that the planets are sorted accurately by their distance.
